value.title: AI under the sea: Autonomous robot to collect data from new depths
value.excerpt: Terradepth CEO talks about a project to map out and collect data from all the oceans of the world. The company uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to gather and make sense of the data.

value.title: MIT Researchers Commercializing RFID and Computer Vision Robotics
value.excerpt: Researchers at the MIT Media Lab are employing radio frequency identification technology along with computer vision to enable robots to explore their environment in order to locate and move a targeted item that may not be visible.

value.title: The Myth of Artificial Intelligence--AcademicInfluence.com Features Author and Computer Scientist Erik Larson
value.excerpt: Not so fast, says author and computer scientist Erik Larson, Ph.D. In his latest book, The Myth of Artificial Intelligence: Why Computers Can't Think the Way We Do, he notes that perhaps the replacement of human beings with artificial intelligence and "thinking machines" is not as imminent as we fear.

value.title: Jumping Robot Looks Like A Product Of Doctor Wily

value.excerpt: With intelligent machines on the horizon and with an industrial focus on enhancing productivity and lowering costs in the post-pandemic era, artificial intelligence (AI) and autonomous robots are destined to win this bid of the future job market.

value.title: East Village gets futuristic grocery store designed by Accel Robotics

value.title: A robot that can help you untangle your hair
value.excerpt: Researchers from MIT and Harvard have developed a robotic arm setup with a sensorized soft brush. The robot is equipped with a camera that helps it “see” and assess curliness, so it can plan a delicate and time-efficient brush-out.

value.title: Trifo Lucy Robot Vacuum review: Eyes that prioritize security over cleaning
value.excerpt: The Trifo Lucy is a highly anticipated robot vacuum that not only vacuums but can also double as a useful security camera for the home when you're not there.

value.title: POLITICO AI: Decoded: Robot law — Helsinki wants to be Europe’s smartest — China on facial recognition
value.excerpt: How global thinking on AI is shaping the world, from Berlin, Brussels, London and beyond. POLITICO’s AI correspondent cuts through the noise, introduces you to the key decision-makers you’ve never heard of and tells you what those in power don’t want you to know.
